p: The present study showed that P. minus essential oil contained high concentration of long-chain aldehyde (52.47 %). A study done by Lu and Cederbaum (2006[ 54]) showed a combination of acetone and cisplatin in increasing the production of ROS which then potentiates the cellular oxidative stress and reduction in GSH levels in the in vitro model. Higher concentration of aldehyde that is present in the high concentration of P. minus essential oil could be the possible reason for the pro-oxidant, pro-inflammatory and pro-apoptotic effects seen in PmEO400CP group.
